column4: I have a folder with all my music in it, in tons of sorted subfolders
i need to take only the flacs, and convert them to vorbis
i tried soundconverter but there is no easy way to remove the mp3s and oggs from the list
i only want to transcode the flacs to oggs, is there a simple way to do that while leaving the mp3s and oggs in the folder out?
i've a method you could use
i don't have any in mind at the moment
i am thinking something using find *.flac then piping that to oggenc
in windows i used to do a search for *.flac, drag and drop the files to foobar2000, and use that to convert
if i could drag and drop all the *flac and all the *ape files to soundconverter, that would make my day
i can build something on that
is there a way i can just move all the flacs and apes into one folder?
i guess i can using a variant of that command, thanks
will that be recursive, since they're all in subdirectories?
i did this before with some commandline using "find"
find . -name '*.mp3'-type f -exec mv '{}' . \ drops all mp3's out the subfolders to the base dir but if there are dups they will get wiped
